sentence.Network_en: Dolores, please come in and countersign a cheque.
sentence.Network_cn: 多洛雷斯，请进来连署支票。

sentence.Network_en: The President has so far refused to countersign the Prime Minister's desperate decree.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统到目前为止仍然拒绝在首相那条孤注一掷的政令上连署签字。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as a noun): from French contresigner (verb), contresigne (noun), from Italian contrassegno, based on Latin signum 'sign'

entry.def: If you countersign a document, you sign it after someone else has signed it.

example.ex: The President has so far refused to countersign the Prime Minister's desperate decree...
example.tran: 总统到目前为止仍然拒绝在首相那条孤注一掷的政令上连署签字。

example.ex: Dolores, please come in and countersign a cheque.
example.tran: 多洛雷斯，请进来连署支票。

means.word_mean: 1. a secret word or phrase known only to a restricted group;
2. a second confirming signature endorsing a document already signed
1. add one's signature to after another's to attest authenticity;

sentences.sentence: "You must countersign on this line of the contract"

sentences.en: Enclosed is our contract No. 345 in duplicate, of which please return us one copy, duly countersign.
sentences.cn: 随函附上我方第345号合同一式两分，请会签并回寄一份。
